Signs - a contemporary dance piece, fusing contemporary dance with British Sign Language.

Watch the trailer

What

Signs is a 30-minute contemporary dance piece, fusing contemporary dance with British Sign Language. Performed by two female dancers, this exciting and intricate work explores the importance of body language in British Sign Language, aiming to raise awareness about the culture of the deaf community.

Signs is an Arts Council England funded project with support from Arch 197, Candoco, Hive and Clarence Mews.

Choreographer: Monica Nicolaides
Composer: Zory Burner
Dancers: Erena Bordon Sanchez and Laura Heywood
Producer: Lottie Barker

www.monixarts.com
monica@monixarts.com

Who

MonixArts

MonixArts creates contemporary dance works, investigating human relationships and issues in current society. Working with how the human body moves in space, we combine contemporary dance with martial arts and everyday movement. Influenced by the dynamics of other movement languages and everyday life, we explore human behaviour wanting to hone into what makes us us.

Monica Nicolaides

A contemporary choreographer based in London, with a BA (Hons) Dance with Fine Art: New Media and an MA Performance: Dance. She worked as a dancer / choreographer for several years, with performing credits including: London Olympic Ceremonies, BskyB, Universal Studios, Torifune Butoh-Sha, Warner Brothers, Valentine Pictures, mapdance, Carpe Diem, Dance Digital, Valentine Pictures, The V&A, The Barbican, amongst others. Her choreographic portfolio includes commissions for the British Medical Association, Woking Dance, Marylebone Ballet School, Third Row Dance and the University of Cumbria, and co-choreographer for Carpe Diem ballet productions Coppelia and Nutcracker.

When

Thursday 13 October 2016, 20:00

The Blue Elephant Theatre
59a Bethwin Road, Camberwell SE50XT, London
